intro: Leandra euphorbioides, commonly known as the silverleaf leandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
